text: it seemed like a fun idea spend a night
at the most infamous motel in Hollywood
history
so I went to Canada where a Andy is
filming a TV show called Bates Motel a
prequel to Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho
I love you too long
i'm neil genzlinger for the new york
times and the show's producers thought I
was insane when I told them I wanted to
actually sleep on the set and maybe I
was but they said sure it's your funeral
and so during the day I watched the
filming of the show I explored the set
recording everything on this old camera
just in case
I visited the old Bates house on a hill
behind the motel it's not a real house
just a couple of walls but it does have
a famous resident who can be seen in the
windows from time to time it was a long
day of filming in the rain and then the
crew wrapped and I was alone in the dark
just me and my thoughts my nightmares
they told me there was a security guard
patrolling the grounds but when I poked
my head outside this is what I heard
coyotes and they were right across the
street I don't know if coyotes can read
but I hung out and I do not disturb sign
just in case back inside I found a tray
of treats that had been left for my
benefit by the crew
it included a five alive juice box that
seemed to be asking a question five
alive we'll see well I was still alive
at 5:00 I had even gotten a little sleep
at 6:00 there was a knock on my door
it was Norma Bates herself or more
accurately the actress Vera Farmiga who
plays Norma in the show
she had brought me a full breakfast at
an awfully sharp knife for pancakes my
final challenge for this haunting motel
stay was to take a shower having seen an
episode of the show I knew that there
had already been at least one dead body
in this bathtub so it was with some
trepidation that I stepped in it was
just a TV set the plumbing wasn't
actually hooked up which meant that the
bathtub didn't drain and a crew member
had to pump the water for the shower in
through a back window and as I showered
all I could think was how much do I
really know about water pumping down
finally it was over so yeah it was
possible to get through a night and a
shower at the Bates Motel unscarred at
least physically
